text: Terence Richard "Terry" McAuliffe (born February 9, 1957) is an American politician. In 2014, he became the 72nd Governor of Virginia. His term ended on January 13, 2018, when he was succeeded in his position by Lieutenant Governor Ralph Northam. McAuliffe began his business career at the age of 14. He was seen as a possible candidate for President of the United States in the 2020. On December 8, 2020, McAuliffe announced he would run for Governor again in the 2021 election. In June 2021, he won the Democratic nomination winning 62% of the vote. In November, he lost the election to Republican Glenn Youngkin. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website Category:Governors of Virginia Category:1957 births Category:Living people Category:Businesspeople from Virginia Category:Businesspeople from New York (state) Category:Politicians from Syracuse, New York Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Terry McAuliffe
